intro: Chamaeangis orientalis, commonly known as the oriental chamaeangis, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Chamaeangis orientalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
